overview:
Jeff Stibel currently serves as Chairman, President and CEO of The Dun & Bradstreet Credibility Corp. He was previously President and CEO of Web.com (NASDAQ: WWWW) and President of Website Pros (NASDAQ: WSPI). Prior to Web.com, Stibel was General Manager and SVP at United Online (NASDAQ: UNTD), a technology company that owns and operates leading web services, including NetZero, Juno, and Classmates.com. Prior to United Online, Stibel founded Simpli.com, a search engine marketing company currently owned by ValueClick (NASDAQ: VCLK). He has founded numerous companies and served on the board of directors for Web.com, Autobytel (NASDAQ: ABTL), VitaCost (NASDAQ: VITC) and several private companies, including BrainGate, The Search Agency, Zeo, and EdgeCast.

Stibel also serves on the Board of Brown University’s Entrepreneurship Program and Tufts University’s Gordon Center for Leadership. Stibel currently writes for Harvard Business School Publishing and has authored numerous articles and books on a variety of subjects, including Wired for Thought: How the Brain is Shaping the Future of the Internet (Harvard Business Press, 2009). He is the named inventor on the U.S. patent for Search Engine Interfaces. Stibel studied business at MIT’s Sloan School and received his Master’s degree from Brown University where he was the recipient of the Brain and Behavior Fellowship while studying for his PhD.

funding_round.source_description: Members-Only Airline Surf Air Raises Series A From Anthem, NEA & Others (Including Jared Leto)
